Lack enough support: The claim does not provide any specific evidence or sources to support the authenticity and accuracy of the viral social media post.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the viral social media post represents an authentic and accurate "health bulletin" from an official public health authority, without providing any concrete proof or verification.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no information provided about any alternative explanations or perspectives regarding the origins and credibility of the viral social media post.
Understate: The claim does not understate any information.
Exaggerate: The claim does not exaggerate any information.
Contradict fact: The claim does not contradict any known facts.
Falters at times: The claim does not falter at times.
